text: 19 millimeter Female photographed at 36° N 80° W. Rabidosa punctulata, the dotted wolf spider, is a species of spider in the family Lycosidae. It is found in areas of weeds and tall grasses. It is a light-brown and large wolf spider with stripes on the cephalothorax and an abdomen with light spots and a dark middle stripe. Its range spreads from Massachusetts west to Kansas south to Texas and Northern Florida.Common Spiders of North America by Richard Alan Bradley, Steve Buchanan page 159 ==References== Category:Endemic fauna of Virginia Category:Lycosidae Category:Spiders of the United States Category:Spiders described in 1844
title: Rabidosa punctulata
